title: Soliloquy
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA; Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1951 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Purchased by Mrs. Beal for $40 ($200 for the "Vanity I" set of five lithographs,) probably in August 1950. A letter 
from John O'Connor to the artist, dated November 14, 1950, acknowledges receipt of the set at Carnegie Institute on October 10, 1950.
[2]. The set of lithographs was accessioned on November 1, 1951.
